CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 22, 1960, pg. 2 reads: "Curtis Haines Goes To Rest - Pallbearers and relatives remain silent as Father Matthews, pastor of St. Luke Episcopal Church, delivers the final burial pronouncement over the remains of Curtis B. Haines on Monday. Interment was in Allegheny Cemetery.  Starting left and reading clockwise, pallbearers and relatives were Elmer Yates, Francis Johnson, Irving Johnson, Lieut. Leo Anderson, Father Matthews, Elizabeth Jennings, sister; Carlton Haines, brother; Dolly Warden, sister; Gladys Haines, widow; Russell Shelton, Thomas Robinson, James Goode and William Hannon. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Elmer Yates, Francis Johnson, Thomas Robinson, James Goode, and police officer, lifting casket with American flag over burial plot in Allegheny cemetery, for Curtis Haines funeral
